column2: iBio, Inc. is a biotechnology company, which engages in the development and manufacture of biotherapeutics. The company is headquartered in New York City, New York and currently employs 7 full-time employees. The firm is focused on commercializing its technologies and product candidates and providing product development and manufacturing services to clients and collaborators. Its technologies include iBioLaunch technology and iBioModulator. The firm's technologies constitute a transformative platform for development and production of biologics in hydroponically grown green plants. The firm is focused on the commercialization of its plant-based protein expression technologies for vaccines and therapeutic proteins and on developing and commercializing select biopharmaceutical product candidates. The firm's technology is applicable in a range of product candidates, including products against fibrotic diseases, vaccines, enzyme replacements, monoclonal antibodies, and recombinant versions of marketed products that are derived from human blood plasma.
